question: Who was awarded The Nobel Prize for deciphering the language of bees?
explanation: K.V. Frisch shared the 1973 Nobel Prize in physiology or medicine with K. Lorenz and N. Tinbergen for his pioneering work in ethology. He deciphered the \'language\' of bees by studying their dance patterns in which one bee tells others in the hive the direction and distance of a food source.
